tasks.title: Redesign Mobile Menu Structure for Enhanced UX and Visual Hierarchy
tasks.description: Restructure mobile header to reduce visual clutter and improve navigation hierarchy using Material Design 3 principles while maintaining all functionality.
tasks.details:
**Scope:** Redesign mobile header (lines 189-487 in index.html) to address visual clutter and improve user experience while maintaining ALL existing functionality.

**Problems Identified:**
1. **Visual Clutter:** Mobile header contains too many competing elements (logo, filter button, view switcher, overflow menu)
2. **Poor Hierarchy:** Unclear distinction between primary (filter, view switch) and secondary actions (export, share, settings)
3. **Filter Experience:** Filter button, quick filters, and active filter chips create chaotic visual flow
4. **Hidden Discoverability:** Important actions buried in overflow menu

**Solution Architecture:**
1. **Primary Action Bar:** Keep essential actions (Filter, View Switcher) in compact header
2. **Bottom Navigation:** Move view switching to bottom nav (Tasks 19/21 completed) - integrate better
3. **Collapsible Sections:** Implement progressive disclosure for quick filters using Alpine.js collapse
4. **Action Sheet Pattern:** Replace overflow menu with Material Design action sheet for bulk actions
5. **Visual Separation:** Use M3 elevation tokens and surface containers for clear hierarchy

**Implementation Details:**
- **Header Redesign:** Reduce header height to 48px (Task 16 done), consolidate logo+title, single primary filter button with badge
- **Progressive Disclosure:** Implement collapsible quick filters section with slide-down animation using @alpinejs/collapse
- **Action Grouping:** Group related actions (Export: ICS/Print, Share: Link/Favorites, Settings: Dark Mode/Location) with clear visual separation
- **M3 Components:** Use existing .md-state-layer, .md-surface-container-high classes from src/styles/m3-components.css
- **Touch Targets:** Maintain â‰¥44px touch targets per WCAG guidelines
- **Accessibility:** Preserve all ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader support

**Technical Implementation:**
- **Alpine.js Store:** Add new state for collapsible sections (quickFiltersExpanded, actionSheetOpen)
- **CSS Classes:** Use M3 surface containers (.md-surface-container, .md-surface-container-high) for elevation hierarchy
- **Animation:** Implement smooth transitions using Alpine collapse plugin and M3 motion tokens
- **Responsive:** Ensure design works across mobile breakpoints (375px, 390px, 428px)
- **Integration:** Coordinate with existing filter chips bar (Task 15) and bottom navigation (Task 19)

**Files Modified:**
- index.html (lines 189-487): Mobile header restructure
- src/styles/m3-components.css: Add action sheet and collapsible components if needed
- src/main.js: Add new Alpine store state for UI controls

**Testing Strategy:**
1. **Responsive Testing:** Validate across mobile viewports (375px iPhone SE, 390px iPhone 12, 428px iPhone 14 Pro Max)

3. **Accessibility Testing:** Run axe-core accessibility audit, test keyboard navigation, verify ARIA attributes
4. **Visual Regression:** Compare before/after screenshots to ensure visual improvements

6. **User Flow Testing:** Test complete filter â†’ view â†’ action flows on mobile devices

8. **Cross-Browser Testing:** Test on Chrome 111+, Firefox 128+, Safari 16.4+ (per package.json browserslist)
9. **Screen Reader Testing:** Validate with VoiceOver (iOS) and TalkBack (Android)
10. **Progressive Enhancement:** Ensure functionality degrades gracefully without JavaScript

**Test Files:**
